description: Also known as the Coulon's Macaw, this is a smaller, rare macaw. It is primarily green with a striking blue head, a patch of red under the tail, and a pale bill tipped in black.
temperament: Known to be intelligent, inquisitive, and generally gentler than other mini-macaws. They can be shy and reserved but are also playful and affectionate with their owners.
loudness: Moderate. Their call is higher-pitched and less grating than large macaws, making them a quieter option, though they can still be noisy.
loudness_icon: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="w-12 h-12 text-yellow-500" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="currentColor" aria-hidden="true" role="img" aria-label="Moderate"><title>Moderate</title><path d="M7 9v6h4l5 5V4l-5 5H7zm9.5 2.5c0 .75-.38 1.41-.97 1.82v-3.64c.59.41.97 1.07.97 1.82zM14 8.25v7.5c1.18-.41 2-1.57 2-2.75s-.82-2.34-2-2.75z"></path></svg>
vocalization: Can learn a few words and phrases, but are not considered exceptional talkers. They are more known for their playful chirps and squawks.
dietaryNeeds: A pelleted diet supplemented with fresh vegetables, fruits, and some nuts. They are known to enjoy foraging for food.
healthPointers: Can live for 30+ years. As they are rare in aviculture, specific health data is limited. A varied diet and regular vet check-ups are crucial. Prone to PDD like other macaws.
housing: Being a mini-macaw, they require a cage of at least 30"W x 24"D x 48"H. Their moderate noise level could make them suitable for some apartment situations with tolerant neighbors.
